intro: Trias floribunda, commonly known as the fragrant triad, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
